title: 107_s1935
content: The Act may be cited as the "Law Enforcement Officers Retirement Equity Act of 2002". It pertains to the Civil Service Retirement System. Section 8331 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include definitions for "revenue officer" and "customs inspector" among other positions. The definition of a 'customs inspector' is an employee of the United States Customs Service primarily responsible for enforcing laws on importing/exporting merchandise, processing passengers and baggage, intercepting smuggled goods, and apprehending violators. A 'customs canine enforcement officer' is an employee who works with a dog to enforce customs laws. The curr_chunk describes the duties of an 'Immigration and Naturalization inspector' as primarily controlling and guarding the boundaries and borders of the United States against illegal entry of aliens. This includes apprehending violators and employees transferred to supervisory roles. The duties of an 'Immigration and Naturalization inspector' involve controlling and guarding US borders against illegal entry, including apprehending violators and employees transferred to supervisory roles. SEC. 3. FEDERAL EMPLOYEES RETIREMENT SYSTEM. Section 8401 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include new definitions such as "revenue officer" as an employee of the Internal Revenue Service responsible for collecting delinquent taxes. The curr_chunk discusses the definition of a customs inspector and a customs canine enforcement officer, outlining their duties related to enforcing customs laws and regulations. This includes activities such as processing passengers and baggage, interdicting smuggled merchandise, and apprehending violators. The curr_chunk defines a customs canine enforcement officer as a Customs Service employee who works with a dog to enforce laws on importing/exporting merchandise, process passengers/baggage, interdict smuggled goods, and apprehend violators. It also defines an Immigration and Naturalization inspector as an employee primarily responsible for controlling immigration and naturalization duties. The duties of the position involve controlling and guarding the boundaries and borders of the United States against illegal entry of aliens. SEC. 4. ADMINISTRATIVE PROVISIONS. Any individual who has served as a revenue officer, customs inspector, customs canine enforcement officer, or Immigration and Naturalization inspector before the effective date of this Act can have their service credited for annuities if they make a payment into the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. The amount to be paid will be determined by the Office of Personnel Management. After the payment is made, the Department of the Treasury or the Department of Justice must make agency contributions within 90 days. The Office of Personnel Management will determine the payment amount to be made into the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund for individuals who served in specified roles before the effective date of the Act. The Department of the Treasury or the Department of Justice must then make agency contributions within 90 days. Regulations may be issued by the Office of Personnel Management to implement the Act. The Act and its amendments will take effect 90 days after enactment.
